Comments_List: This course certainly helps students to learn scientific critical thinking and exposes students to new fields, techniques, and methodologies over the course of the semester.
We learned how to critically assess the experiments published in papers.
Experimental techniques and design; good statistics
How to read primary literature paper and evaluate them critically

This course was instrumental to my development as a young scientist. I learned how to present findings of articles, gained appreciation for the different topics of cell biology, gained appreciation for the concepts behind different techniques, and how to think critically about findings presented in papers.
The most important skill I learned was to better critique the quality of research papers.

This course could benefit from having more emphasis on active engagement in discussion. Most classes, discussion of figures proceeded sequentially around the room, which doesn't always encourage students to participate of their own volition (though it forces basic participation). More directed discussion could perhaps let students dig into WHY a particular method was used or logical conclusion reached. The professors spent a lot of time helping students to look at such things with a critical eye, but this tended to cover more of "I'm not convinced" as opposed to "X would have been better, why did they try Y?"
I really like the way it was structured
The discussions are enjoyable. I also learned a lot from classmates from other fields.
I don't think the style of going around the room figure by figure always works. Although sometimes it is helpful to promote discussion.

A relatively good course, which was structured for students to grasp the concepts of cell biology from reading papers. I would like if the professors pushed the students to think more about the rational behind the experiment and findings of the paper. How do these findings align with the concepts presented?

This course is a great introduction to Cell Biology and the concepts and methods that accompany it. Additionally, I would recommend this course to students who want more experience reading scientific papers and gaining deeper understanding of research in these fields.
Yes, its a great way to improve your critical reading skills
Highly recommended. An enjoyable way to learn from other students. Also helps with planning journal clubs in the future.
Yes. The course provides a good opportunity to learn interesting cell biology.
Yes, this course helps students to develop their reading and critical skills for journal articles.
Yes because its a good class for being introduced to papers from a wide variety of topics
